class opticomlib.typing.binary_sequence(data: str | list | tuple | ndarray)[source]

binary sequence object

Parameters:

data – The data to initialize the binary sequence. It can be a string, list, tuple, or numpy array.

data

The binary sequence data stored as a numpy array. Shape (Nx1).

Type:

ndarray

ejecution_time

The execution time of previous device.

Type:

float

Raises:

  • TypeError – If the data argument is not a string, list, tuple, or numpy array.

  • ValueError – If the string data contains non-binary numbers.

len()[source]

Get the length of the binary sequence data.

print(msg: str | None = None)[source]

Print object parameters.

Parameters:

msg (str) – top message to show

sizeof()[source]

Get memory size of object in bytes.

type()[source]

Get the type of the object

class opticomlib.typing.electrical_signal(signal: list | tuple | ndarray | None = None, noise: list | tuple | ndarray | None = None)[source]

electrical signal object

Parameters:

  • signal (Union[list, tuple, np.ndarray]) – The signal values. Defaults to None.

  • noise (Union[list, tuple, np.ndarray]) – The noise values. Defaults to None.

If signal or noise are not passed as arguments it will be initialized to zeros((N,))

signal

The signal values. Shape (Nx1).

Type:

ndarray

noise

The noise values. Shape (Nx1).

Type:

ndarray

ejecution_time

The execution time of previous device.

Type:

None

abs(by: Literal['signal', 'noise', 'all'] = 'all')[source]

Get abs of electrical signal.

Parameters:

by (str) – defines from which attribute to obtain the abs. If 'all', abs of signal+noise is determinated.

copy(n: int | None = None)[source]

Return a copy of the object

Parameters:

n (int) – index to truncate original object.

dt()[source]

Get time between samples.

fs()[source]

Get sampling rate of signal.

grid(n=None)[source]

Plot vertical grid each every time slot.

Parameters:

n (int) – number of samples to plot (default: self.len()).

Returns:

Same object.

Return type:

electrical_signal

len()[source]

Get the length of the electrical signal data.

plot(fmt: str | None = None, n: int | None = None, xlabel: str | None = None, ylabel: str | None = None, **kargs)[source]

Plot real part of electrical signal.

Parameters:

  • fmt (str) – Format style of line. Example 'b-.'

  • n (int) – number of samples to plot (default: self.len()).

  • xlabel (str) – X-axis label (default - 'Tiempo [ns]').

  • ylabel (str) – Y-axis label (default - 'Amplitud [u.a]').

  • **kargs – all arguments compatible with matplotlib.pyplot.plot().

Returns:

Same object.

Return type:

electrical_signal

power(by: Literal['signal', 'noise', 'all'] = 'all')[source]

Get power of the electrical signal.

Parameters:

by (str) – defines from which attribute to obtain the power. If 'all', power of signal+noise is determinated.

print(msg: str | None = None)[source]

Print object parameters.

Parameters:

msg (str) – top message to show

Returns:

Same object.

Return type:

electrical_signal

psd(fmt=None, kind: Literal['linear', 'log'] = 'log', n=None, **kargs)[source]

Plot Power Spectral Density (PSD) of the electrical signal.

Parameters:

  • fmt (str) – Format style of line. Example 'b-.'

  • kind (str) – kind of Y-axis plot.

  • n (int) – number of samples to plot (default: self.len()).

  • **kargs – all arguments compatible with matplotlib.pyplot.plot().

if 'label' is in kargs.keys(), legend will be show be default.

Returns:

Same object.

Return type:

electrical_signal

w(shift: bool = False)[source]

Return angular frequency for spectrum representation.

Parameters:

shift (bool) – If True apply fftshift(), default False

class opticomlib.typing.eye(eye_dict={})[source]

Eye diagram parameters object.

t

the time values resampled. Shape (Nx1).

Type:

ndarray

y

the signal values resampled. Shape (Nx1).

Type:

ndarray

dt

time between samples.

Type:

float

sps

samples per slot.

Type:

int

t_left

cross time of left edge.

Type:

float

t_right

cross time of right edge.

Type:

float

t_opt

optimal time decision.

Type:

float

t_dist

time between slots.

Type:

float

t_span0

t_opt - t_dist*5%.

Type:

float

t_span1

t_opt + t_dist*5%.

Type:

float

y_top

samples of signal above threshold and within t_span0 and t_apan1.

Type:

ndarray

y_bot

samples of signal below threshold and within t_span0 and t_apan1.

Type:

ndarray

mu0

mean of y_bot.

Type:

float

mu1

mean of y_top.

Type:

float

s0

standard deviation of y_bot.

Type:

float

s1

standard deviation of y_top.

Type:

float

er

extinsion ratio.

Type:

float

eye_h

eye height.

Type:

float

plot(umbral, medias_=True, legend_=True, show_=True, save_=False, filename=None, style: Literal['dark', 'light'] = 'dark', cmap: Literal['viridis', 'plasma', 'inferno', 'cividis', 'magma', 'winter'] = 'winter')[source]

Plot eye diagram.

Parameters:

  • umbral (float) – threshold value.

  • medias (bool) – if True plot mean values.

  • legend (bool) – if True show legend.

  • show (bool) – if True show plot.

  • save (bool) – if True save plot.

  • filename (str) – filename to save plot.

  • style (str) – plot style. 'dark' or 'light'.

  • cmap (str) – colormap to plot.

Returns:

Same object.

Return type:

eye

Parameters:

msg (str) – top message to show

msg (str) – top message to show

eye

class opticomlib.typing.global_variables[source]

global variables object

Parameters:

  • sps (int) – muestras por slot (default: 16)

  • R (float) – tasa de slots en [Hz] (default: 1e9)

  • fs (float) – frecuencia de muestreo en [Hz] (default: R*sps)

  • lambda_opt (float) – longitud de onda del canal óptico en [m] (default: 1550e-9)

sps

muestras por slot

Type:

int

R

tasa de slots en [Hz]

Type:

float

fs

frecuencia de muestreo en [Hz]

Type:

float

dt

paso temporal en [s]

Type:

float

lambda_opt

longitud de onda del canal óptico en [m]

Type:

float

f0

frecuencia central en [Hz]

Type:

float

__call__(sps, R=None, fs=None, lambda_opt=1550e-9)[source]

Updates the global variables.

print()[source]

Prints the global variables.

class opticomlib.typing.optical_signal(signal: list | tuple | ndarray, noise: list | tuple | ndarray | None = None)[source]

optical signal object

Parameters:

  • signal (Union[list, tuple, np.ndarray]) – The signal values. Defaults to None.

  • noise (Union[list, tuple, np.ndarray]) – The noise values. Defaults to None.

If signal or noise are not passed as arguments it will be initialized to zeros((2,N))

signal

The signal values. Shape (2, N).

Type:

ndarray

noise

The noise values. Shape (2, N).

Type:

ndarray

ejecution_time

The execution time of previous device.

Type:

None

grid(n=None)[source]

Plot vertical grid each every time slot.

Parameters:

n (int) – number of samples to plot (default: self.len()).

Returns:

Same object.

Return type:

optical_signal

len()[source]

Get the length of the electrical signal data.

plot(fmt=None, mode: Literal['x', 'y', 'both', 'abs'] = 'abs', n=None, **kargs)[source]

Plot intensity of optical signal for selected mode.

Parameters:

  • fmt (str) – Format style of line. Example 'b-.'

  • mode (str) – Polarization mode to show. 'abs' plot intensity of signal x+y.

  • n (int) – number of samples to plot (default: self.len()).

  • **kargs – all arguments compatible with matplotlib.pyplot.plot().

Returns:

Same object.

Return type:

optical_signal

psd(fmt=None, kind: Literal['linear', 'log'] = 'log', mode: Literal['x', 'y'] = 'x', n=None, **kargs)[source]

Plot Power Spectral Density (PSD) of the optical signal.

Parameters:

  • fmt (str) – Format style of line. Example 'b-.'

  • kind (str) – kind of Y-axis plot.

  • mode (str) – polarization mode to show.

  • n (int) – number of samples to plot (default: self.len()).

  • **kargs – all arguments compatible with matplotlib.pyplot.plot().

if 'label' is in kargs.keys(), legend will be show be default.

Returns:

Same object.

Return type:

optical_signal
